page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TREDIS
page.content: 02320054 is a sparsely-populated country area of East Cornwall,bounded by cliffs and the sea to the South, part of the village of Polbathic to the North. The peripheries of four villages are contained within this block; Downderry to the South-West, Port Wrinkle to the South-East, Crafthole to the East and Polbathic. Thus there is no centre of population; apart from the hamlet of Narkurs the dwellings are mainly isolated farms and cottages.{TREDIS}farm is used as the central reference point. This Survey was conducted in August, 1985.It was a particularly wet,windy, grey month ;the lowest point of a bad summer.This must have effected the two main industries of the area; agriculture & tourism.
